title: Electromagnetism - force on loop entering B field

content.description: A rectangular conducting loop is moving to the right at a constant speed as it enters a region of uniform magnetic field that is directed out of the plane of the figure, as shown. The top, right, bottom, and left segments of the loop are labeled <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>Q</mtext> </math>, <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>R</mtext> </math>, <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mtext>T</mtext></math>, respectively.
content.question: Which of the following correctly indicates the direction of the net magnetic force on the loop and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: To the left, because a leftward force is exerted on Segment <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math>, no force is exerted on Segment <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mtext>T</mtext></math>, and the forces exerted on Segment <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math> and Segment <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math> are equal and opposite

To the left, because a leftward force is exerted on both Segment <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math> and Segment <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math>, and no forces are exerted on Segment <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math> and Segment <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mtext>T</mtext></math>
No direction, because the velocity of the loop is constant and therefore no magnetic forces are exerted on any of the loop segments
No direction, because the forces exerted on opposite segments are equal and opposite and therefore the net force on the loop is zero

content.answer: To the left, because a leftward force is exerted on Segment <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math>, no force is exerted on Segment <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mtext>T</mtext></math>, and the forces exerted on Segment <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math> and Segment <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math> are equal and opposite

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
